intro: Pedicularis crenulata, commonly known as the serrated lousewort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or red, with a distinctive bilaterally symmetrical shape. Its leaves are alternate and often have a serrated or toothed margin, contributing to its common name. Pedicularis crenulata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
